pullRequest.body:
Multiply Dirichlet characters at a common level and obtain their associated primitive character. It also includes a lemma confirming the primitiveness of the resulting character.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

Please update the PR title to match the commit conventions, and preferably add a short PR description,
LGTM.
LGTM.
Please update the PR title to match the commit conventions, and preferably add a short PR description,
Can you add a return type annotation?
done

Are you sure you don't just want:
```lean
noncomputable def mul {m : ℕ} (χ₁ : DirichletCharacter R n) (χ₂ : DirichletCharacter R m) :
    DirichletCharacter R (Nat.lcm n m) :=
  changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_left n m) χ₁ * changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_right n m) χ₂
```
and then let the caller use `primitiveCharacter` if they want the primitive one?

I am not really sure. Traditionally, multiplication is only defined for primitive characters and naturally these two definitions would then collide. Going ahead a lot of proofs are for the primitive character as well. I suppose one could define `mul` and `primitive_mul`.

```lean
/-- Dirichlet character associated to multiplication of Dirichlet characters,
after changing both levels to the same -/
noncomputable def mul {m : ℕ} (χ₁ : DirichletCharacter R n) (χ₂ : DirichletCharacter R m) :
    DirichletCharacter R
      (Nat.lcm n m) :=
  changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_left n m) χ₁ * changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_right n m) χ₂

/-- Primitive character associated to multiplication of Dirichlet characters,
after changing both levels to the same -/
noncomputable def primitive_mul {m : ℕ} (χ₁ : DirichletCharacter R n) (χ₂ : DirichletCharacter R m) :
    DirichletCharacter R
      (changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_left n m) χ₁ * changeLevel (Nat.dvd_lcm_right n m) χ₂).conductor :=
  primitiveCharacter (mul χ₁ χ₂)
```
I think this should work

The nice thing about defining `mul` first is that you can write the type more succintly:
```lean
/-- Primitive character associated to multiplication of Dirichlet characters,
after changing both levels to the same -/
noncomputable def primitive_mul {m : ℕ} (χ₁ : DirichletCharacter R n) (χ₂ : DirichletCharacter R m) :
    DirichletCharacter R (mul χ₁ χ₂).conductor :=
  primitiveCharacter (mul χ₁ χ₂)
```
Of course then the question arises of whether `primitive_mul χ₁ χ₂` is worth having when you can write `primitiveCharacter (mul χ₁ χ₂)` which is only a few character longer (and could be shortened if you renamed `primitiveCharacter` to `primitive`.

Nice, @eric-wieser and @laughinggas! That makes a lot of sense to me.
I adapted the code to reflect the suggestions...
I am happy with that.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: mul for DirichletCharacter
